title: Swaroops
content:
Guruji Swaroops

Swaroops are divine images and representations of Guruji Nirmal Singh Maharaj that capture his spiritual presence and blessings. Devotees keep these sacred images in their homes, workplaces, and places of worship to maintain a constant connection with Guruji's divine energy.

The Significance of Swaroops

Guruji himself blessed certain photographs and images, infusing them with his spiritual power. These swaroops serve as:

  • Points of Focus: For meditation and prayer
  • Sources of Blessings: Radiating Guruji's healing energy
  • Reminders: Of his eternal presence and teachings
  • Connections: To the divine consciousness Guruji embodied

Types of Swaroops

1. Blessing Pose

The most common and beloved swaroop shows Guruji with his hand raised in blessing. This image represents his constant showering of grace upon devotees. Many followers report feeling his presence most strongly through this representation.

2. Meditation Pose

Images of Guruji in deep meditation capture his inner silence and spiritual depth. These swaroops are particularly powerful for those seeking inner peace and spiritual growth.

3. Sangat Photographs

Candid photographs from Guruji's sangats show him interacting with devotees. These images remind us of his accessibility and loving nature.

How to Use Swaroops

  • Home Altar: Place a swaroop in your prayer room or meditation space
  • Workplace: Keep a small image at your desk for blessings during work
  • Vehicle: Many devotees keep a swaroop in their car for protection
  • Personal Items: Carry a small photo in your wallet or phone case

Respecting the Swaroops

Swaroops are considered sacred and should be treated with reverence:

  • Keep them clean and in a respected place
  • Never place them on the floor or in inappropriate locations
  • Offer flowers, incense, or light a diya before them
  • Approach them with a pure heart and devotion

Shukrana

Through these swaroops, Guruji continues to bless and guide his devotees. As he said, "Blessings always" â€“ his grace flows eternally to those who seek him with sincerity.

Jai Guruji!
